org.openimaj.video.processing.effects

Class SlitScanProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.video.Video<T>
      • org.openimaj.video.processor.VideoProcessor<MBFImage>
        • org.openimaj.video.processing.effects.SlitScanProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<MBFImage>

    public class SlitScanProcessor
extends VideoProcessor<MBFImage>
    VideoProcessor that produces a slit-scan effect.
    Author:
    Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

        Default constructor for using the video processor in an ad-hoc manner.

        cacheSize - The number of frames to retain for creating the slitscan effect

    • Method Detail

      • processFrame

        public MBFImage processFrame(MBFImage frame)
        Description copied from class: VideoProcessor
        Process a frame in this video. The processor must determine itself what is to be done with the frame that is processed. It is suggest that subclass processors add listeners for processed frames if they are required. The implementation must process the frame in-place and the frame should be returned.
        Specified by:
        processFrame in class VideoProcessor<MBFImage>
        Parameters:
        frame - The frame to process.
        Returns:
        the processed frame
